intro: Microstylis lobatocallosa, commonly known as the broad-lobed microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct, waxy coating. Microstylis lobatocallosa plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
